text:
WimBiz has actually gone through its own
transformation because in the early days

it was about women in careers, women
in business, entrepreneurs.

But then we started realizing that,
you know, this problem of a lack of women

is not only in business
or in entrepreneurship.
It's also in politics.

It's also in government - in the civil
servants.
It's also on boards.

And so we started to metamorphose,
if I could say, into

looking at gender equality
in different areas.

WIMBoard is the one
that is really special to me
because I sit on quite a few boards.

And on a number of those boards,
I am one of a few women.

And I see the value that women can bring,
not because they're women, but

just because they have
a different perspective on things

and that mix of perspectives really
does help you make better decisions
as an organization.

So we have a database of women
that we've gathered.

We do trainings
to get women to be Board-ready.

And so when people say, "Oh, we can't find
a female candidates for our board."
Just hold on. Hold on.
We have two thousand here. Here you go.
You know, just choose from them.
Here's a list.
